Myth and Magic

Long before the renaissance, when the old gods were still strong and the world was not so well known, men of myth and magic still walked the Earth, though their deeds are now forgotten. Giants roamed in the north, undying men with the blood of wolves and bats inspired the fear of the world, and some dabbled in the mystical arts. Through the ages their history became legend, and legend became myth, but in another time, they might instead thrive.

Chief and first among the wolfmen, Velnias leads his small clan as they struggle to survive in a world that fears and does not understand them. Some say the blood of the wolf is a curse, but it may prove to be a blessing...

Brynjolf is among the last few of the old and simple race of giants. His people were made into myths and hunted nearly to extinction by the Northmen who feared them as evil gods, and now they scrape out a living in the far northern mountains, waiting for their chance to return.

The infamous Vlad the Impaler was known for his brutality. To strike fear into the hearts of his enemies, he made examples of entire towns, impaling the villagers on spikes for all to see. But some say his cruelty was more than just malice, and that he not only killed, but was an undead abomination himself that fed upon the blood of the living. Was he cursed by God... or blessed by the Devil?

As Christianity spread throughout Europe, it brought with it teachings that minimized or even demonized the magical arts. As the years passed, court wizards faded into obscurity and no longer had the trust of their Lords. Rhodric is one of few left who still believe in them, and even has some magical talents of his own..

Argos of Achaia is a proud man who believes in faith and tradition. His family through the generations watched as Rome adopted Christianity, then split in two and has declined ever since. In Argos' mind, this is no coincidence, and he strives to return to the traditional Greek faith. Will he relent and pray to the God of his Basileus, or press even harder to return to the glory of the past?

The dragons were once a proud and prolific race, respected for their wisdom and feared for their strength. Over the ages, fear won over respect, and men betrayed and hunted down the mythical beasts whose corpses now litter the world. "Dragonslayers" were praised as heroes, while their victims were condemned as monsters. Rugarth and his family are among the few dragons left in the world, on an island so cut off from it that they and the humans there live in peace.

We must investigate.
We should not disturb these graves.

We must have this treasure!

Cancel
Don't cast a spell.
The spell is cast.  From within the bounds of the mystic circle spouts of torrent of flame and inside stands a young dragon wearing what appears to be a dragon's version of the vestments of a steward
A dragon steward? That works.
The spell is cast.  As a chill takes hold over the room, a huge man in heavy armor stands in the circle.  He towers over you, head brushing against the ceiling.
This giant will make my enemies tremble.

Before the spell is even completed, a man appears before you to answer your summons with an offer of contract.  This creature of skill and power will serve you faithfully for four and twenty year, until at the last day's final bell, you will return with him, your soul consigned to hell.
Who snares the devil holds him tight.
This price is too steep. Begone!

Completing the spell, a stillness comes over the room, until the door bursts forth and a grim specter moves in, drawing a chain clasped around its middle, long and winding locked to cash boxes, padlocks, ledgers, deeds, and steel purses.
So, I take it this specter's good with money?
When the spell was complete, immediately a frightful genie rose out of the earth, saying What wouldst thou with me? I am the slave of the summoner and will obey thee in all things
I'm sure I can find a use for you.
When the smoke and lights of the summoning cleared, before me stood a strange, inhuman man.  He claimed to have been a general in service to King Solomon and now offers his service to me.
Impressive credentials.
The spell is complete. Before you stands a form neither fully human nor wolf, but some dire mix of both. It lunges at you, but is stopped my the spell.
Heel!
The spell finishes.  Before me stands a soldier in full armor, yet he is not entirely there  you feel that if you were to reach out, your hand would pass right through him.
A soldier that doesn't fear death...
When the spell completed, a body appeared before you, pale and unmoving. At first you though the spell had failed and summoned a corpse until it stood up
A success!
When the spell completed, a man appeared before you in simple robes.  He claimed to be son of god, here to save you.
The church won't like this, but I can make this work.
When the spell finished, a man stood before you with a vacant stare and rotting flesh.  There was no mistaking this man for anything but a corpse save for one fact  he still moves.
The start of an army of the moving dead?

It has been twenty-four years, yet it still feels too soon.  [mephisto.GetFirstName] has come to me to collect what is owed.  There's no where I can flee that he can't follow and no way I can fight him.
Please.  I don't want to die...
The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  A dragon appeared before me, but seemed unfettered by the spell.  He simply looked on me with disdain and walked out of the circle.
I have a bad feeling about this
The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  A man appeared before me, but when I tried to give him orders, he just laughed and vanished in a cloud of black smoke.
That's rarely a good sign.
The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  The person before me wore foreign clerical vestments and was unhindered by the bonds the spell should have place and simply left with a scowl
They could cause trouble

The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  A wolf appeared before me and lunged at me, unhindered by the magical protections. Its claws and teeth sunk in painfully, but I managed to thow it off and it ran away.
This is bad. This is really bad.
The spell is complete, but I think something went wrong.  Instead of some powerful creature, a weak peasent appeared, seemingly sickly and unwell.
I feel sick..

The spell is complete, but something is off.. A very attractive figure appeared before me, yet I get the feeling that they are in someway unwell.  When I looked away in thought, they somehow escaped the summoning circle.
Something isn't right.
Enough is enough.  I've cast a banishment spell and every magically summoned being in by court should be forced back to wherever they call home.
Good riddance
All summoned creatures are banished from the realm
I thought my spell had worked, but I've heard that as soon as I released [From.GetTitledFirstName] from prison, [From.GetSheHe] went back to [From.GetHerHis] old ways.
I was tricked!
It's expected that every dragon will eventually lend their breath to the Eternal Flames.  Now seems like a good time.
I'll make travel plans.
I will visit the temple.
There are two eternal flames in the isles.
With the continental Eternal Flames destroyed by the humans, I will need to travel to the western isles to visit the flames there.
I will visit the flame in Galloway
I will aid the flame in Kent
[Root.GetTitledName] took a pious pilgrimage to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Galloway.
[Root.GetTitledName] took a pious pilgrimage to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Kent.

With the Flames on the isles destroyed by the humans, I will need to sail across the channel to seek one of the flames on the mainland.
I will renew the flame in Sjaelland.
I will travel to Uppland.
I will see the southern flame in Plock.

My things are packed, everything is in order. Soon, I shall see fair Galloway and its Eternal Flame.
My journey begins!
I have my traveling supplies ready.  I shall strike out to strengthen the Eternal Flame in Kent, where dragons first landed on the isles.
My things are packed, everything is in order. Soon, I shall lend my strength to the central flame in Sjaelland
I already live only a short distance from one of the Eternal Flames. I will present myself to the temple and prepare to aid it.
I shall stay here, then.
Everything is packed.  It's time to go to Landvaettir's eternal flame in Uppland.
I have my traveling supplies ready.  I shall strike out to strengthen Wawel's Eternal Flame in Plock
Galloway

We have finally arrived in Galloway.  We will pay a visit to the temple at Whithorn, then head north to visit the Eternal Flame at Torhouse.  Legends say that this flame was created by the god Dewi to protect and support the dragons furthest in the west.  The flame burns without fuel or tinder above three stones at the center of a stone circle.
A green and pleasant land!
The rain has been pouring down for days.  It's been impossible to make and progress on the flooded roads, and traveling through plains or woods in this weather is slow and miserable.
This is a test of my faith and dedication.
This is a waste of time.  I should have stayed home.

You look out across the beautiful valley stretching out before you. It would be a wonderful moment, if not for the fact that there should be no valley here. You are a pilgrim in an unfamiliar land and you have no idea where you are.
If only I hadn't listened to those useless humans that gave me directions.
If only I'd listened more to those humans that gave me directions.

Much of the trip has been through the outskirts of land, on roads not protected by any chief or king.  This has become all too apparent as we came across a group of brigands demanding a 'toll' in exchange for safe passafe.
Pay up.
I'll pay with claw and sword!
The old wooden bridge has carried many pilgrims in its day. It creaks suspiciously as you step on it.
No time to stop. I'm sure it will hold.
Stop and repair it.
These people deserve a stone bridge.  I will pay for its construction.
As winter sets in, the weather beings to turn.  A blizzard has set in and the road in becoming increasingly difficult.
We need to push on
We will stay a few days at the next inn we come across.

You lie awake at night, pondering the purpose of your journey.  Every dragon is supposed to lend their breath to the Eternal Flames, but so few do.  What would happen if they went out? Could they not just be reignited? And while they protected the dragons of old, do they still server some higher purpose?
I will trust the gods and heed their commands.
I already started the journey, so I may as well finish it.  That's reason enough.

I my journey, I met a human along the road.  When I told [curious_human.GetHerHim] why I was traveling, they were curious about my faith.  I explained our history and beliefs about dragons' souls when [curious_human.GetSheHe] asked where humans fit in.
Human souls are strengthened through hard work.
I don't know... I should look in to that for you.
Humans don't matter.
The Flood

There have been heavy rains in the area and the road you've been following has been cut off by a wide and swift river.  You can just fly over it, but a number of local farmers have been cut off and need help getting across.
I'll take the people, but their carts are livestock aren't worth the effort
It will be a lot of work, but I can handle it.
Well, good luck with that.
The Flood

There have been strong rains in the area lately, and the valley that you need to cross has been transformed into a sizeable lake. The water is still rising, so you start to build a large raft in order to cross. When you're almost finished building it, a group of farmers show up and explain that they also need to cross the valley in order to get back to their homes. They bring with them a number of animals that they've rescued from the flood.
None of these humans are setting their filthy feet on my raft.
Bring the farmers with all their animals.
Only let them bring the cats and dogs.
On the road, I ended up meeting another dragon on his way to the Eternal Flame.  We chatted a long the way, and it made the whole trip seem much shorter
I had a great time!
On the road, I met a traveling merchant heading back from his own trip to the Eternal Flame.  He claimed he was selling holy relics to pilgrims and promised great prices
One of the skulls of the Lernaean Hydra
A torch with fire from the Eternal Flame
A coin from Fafnir the Great's hoard
Undoubtedly all fakes
Great prices? I can't afford any of this.

You have spent the last fews days of your journey on water. The vessel you are travelling on rocks gently in the breeze, as the sailors go about their business. Being on board ship is quite unlike being on land  so much is different, so many strange words for all the things here. Starboard? Abaft? Aground? What does it all mean?
This is an excellent opportunity to learn some new skills.
When will I need to sail a boat? I will spend my time in prayer.

As you stop to make camp near a river crossing along with other pilgrims, you observe a group of builders working on a new bridge just upstream. You walk up to them and see that the arches of the bridge are already half completed. The master builder notices your interest and walks up to you and offers to tell you about the construction techniques they are using.
Yes, tell me more about it.
Nobles build castles. This is for peasants.
Bridges are for those who can't just fly over.

The journey has been long and hard and your entire body aches.  Far from the castle kitchens the food is barely edible, and on top of that you seem to feel cold all the time.  Perhaps you were not quite cut out for this pilgrimage thing.
It's the Flame that matters. My body can wait.
Maybe this was a bad idea.  I should rest for a while.
As I was heading along the trail, I came across a village in rather poor condition.  It turns out that a blight wiped out their crops and they are having trouble making ends meet.
I can spare some money to help them.
It takes more than a sob story to get my money.
As I laid down to sleep, I began to think about my parents, their behavior, and the example they've set for me.
They weren't the best role models.
They raised me right.
Every night, there has been a single, bright start in the sky that has caught my attention.  It outshines those around it and has remained in a constant position over my destination.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] is guiding and protecting me.
It's a star. So what?
It's an ill omen.
Riders approach...

Thundering hooves are heard down the road. The pilgrims look with apprehension at the rising dust cloud. As the riders close, steel armour and steel-tipped lances reflect the bright sunlight. The tension rises, but then a collective sigh of relief is heard as the banner of the holy knights is seen flying above the mass of armored men. The knights halt before the pilgrims and graciously offer to accompany you on the road.

Thundering hooves are heard down the road. The pilgrims look with apprehension at the rising dust cloud. As the riders close, steel armour and steel-tipped lances reflect the bright sunlight. The tension rises, but then a collective sigh of relief is heard as they dismount and bow before me, recognizing me as the Sapphire Flame.  They are an order of holy knights here to escort me on my visit.
Praised be [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]! A most welcome escort!
Never trust armed men who appear out of nowhere.

Discuss theology with the knights.
Trade stories of war.

During the last couple of days, you have made company on the road with a holy knight on his way to the same destination. You have lively and interesting conversations, and you find that you have many things in common,
How unexpected, to make a new friend this far from home.
I have no need for friends.
Kent

You have arrived in Kent.  When the dragons first arrived here, Zirnita created on of the Eternal Flames in an underground chamber to protect the early dragons.  Though the Christians have built one of their temples over it, there are still secret ways for worshippers to get to the flame.
The long road is over.
Sjaelland

After the powerful yet impatient dragon Sigurd was cursed to become human for trying to slay Fafnir, in his rage he attempted to extinguish the Eternal Flame in Sjaelland.  Banding together, the dragons were able to drive him off, but at the cost of many lives.  When strengthening Sjaelland's flame, we not only fulfill our duty, but honor those who died to protect it.
Their sacrifice will not be forgotten.
The Eternal Flame

The Eternal Flames were lit by the gods as we fled west to escape the constant attacks by the numerous humans jealous of our power and birthright.  The flames would protect our settlements from the elements, and in exchange, we would lend our breath to keep them burning.

The Eternal Flames were lit by the gods as we fled west to escape the constant attacks by the numerous humans jealous of our power and birthright.  The flames would protect our settlements from the elements and heat the world-egg to keep the next world alive until it can hatch.  In exchange for the Flames' protection, every dragon is charges with lending their breath to keep the Flames active.
I will fulfill my duty.
Uppland

You have made it up Uppland, home of the Eternal Flame birthed by Landvættir to protect us as we fled from our old homes in Asaland and Sumeria.  Our old settlements grew in the light and protection of the flame until we were once again driven out by the growing human threat.
We will reclaim our heritage.
Plock

The oldest of the Eternal Flames, the Flame at Plock was created by Wawel to protect our first settlements as we fled from attacks in the east.  Legends say that humans could once breathe fire, but gre jealous of the strength of dragonfire and tried to consume this Flame to take the power for themselves. Instead it burned their mouths and they lost what fire they had and survived only by being taught to make file from sticks and stone.
I should see the ancient sites while I am here.

As you walk around on this holy ground, you ponder the secrets and the essences of the gods.  The teachings of the priest and seers have never seemed as real to you as they do now.  Imagine the knowledge contained in the scriptures and writing here.
I will learn much from the draconic histories.
Study does not strengthen the soul.

The presence of the Eternal Flame is overwhelming! I realize that all my life up to this point has merely been preparation for this journey.  How wonderous it is for the light of the Eternal Flames to finally shine on me!  From now on, I shall dedicate my life to the teachings of the gods.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
Travelling all this way to see the Eternal Flame, you had expected more than this. It's pretty much just a bonfire, which you've seen plenty of.  This isn't anything special
That's it?

The bustling mass as pilgrims is impressive, as are the many languages and the color and style of clothes, horns, and clothes among the dragons visiting.  You're standing at a place where the roads meet, and that is a natural place for both dragons and dragonborn to gather.
Take the opportunity to observe different languages and customs.
Take the opportunity to meet new people.

The stories of other pilgrims all spoke of how impressive this place is. Now that you can see it with your own eyes, you can only join in their praise. You are glad that you came here, to one of the holiest places among dragon-kind.
It was well worth the journey!

As you approach the holy temple, you overhear a theological discussion between several priests. You stop and eagerly engage them in conversation, expanding upon several of your favorite topics. They are very impressed by your knowledge and invite you to hold a lecture for a group of assembled religious scholars.
I will be most pleased the share my knowledge.

As soon as I entered the temple, the priest recognized me as the Sapphire Flame.  He was very eager for me to deliver a sermon today.  I didn't have anything prepared, but I agreed anyway.  Now I just need to determine the topic
Something simple  the importance of hording gold.
I will teach how dragonkind needs to expand.
Our enemies are everywhere  I will stress vigilance.
I will talk about the Eternal Flames  that's why I'm here.

When I first looked into the Eternal Flame, I same move than simply fire  I saw images moving through the flame.  I've heard of people seeing visions in the fire, and now I find myself seeing them as well.
I see wealth and prosperity.
I see visions of the gods.
I see images of peace and tranquility.
I see realms bowing before me.
I... I can't understand these images.
So far from home, all alone, and so many lovely people in the same situation as me. It's a great opportunity for some fun, isn't it?
I'm sure I can find someone to keep me company.
That's not what I'm here for

This holy place is bustling with pilgrims from all over the world, and a myriad of accents and languages mingle in the parks and plazas. In this great cultural melting pot, should there not also be room for me to express who I really am?
The folks at home will never know
I'm here with a purpose, and that isn't it.

All these magnificent temples built in your honor! Oh the glory! And all these pilgrims - finally you may revel in their adulation. Perhaps you should reveal yourself to the masses who have come to worship you?
Speak to them!
No, I shall enjoy this glorious time in silence.
I came her to attend to the Flame and show my devotions, but with so many luxuries and taverns here, surely I can take some time fo fun behorehand.
To the tavern!
The Flame comes first.  I have to control myself.
I find a secluded area outside of town to go through the ritual cleanings expected of all pilgrims before lending their breath to the Eternal Flame.
A clean body reflects a clean soul.
Is all this pageantry really necessary?

Don't worry, I know how to pass the time

Help him out

I will perform the blessings at local shrines

I can help the priest with all the paperwork he has piled up.

I'll just take a little from the coffers.
I'm not going to steal from the temple!

Without any trouble you broke in to the reliquary, grabbed the first box you saw, and got out, and it seems no one is the wiser.
I wonder what I got
It's interesting to see all the variety of pilgrims that visit the city with different languages and cultures.  As you think about it, it seems like a great opportunity for a bit of fun.
I'm sure someone needs a bit of company.
I need to control myself.

This pilgrimage has turned your thoughts towards your soul and the next world.  You've been taught that a dragon's soul is that of gold and that getting more will strengthen it to prepare you for the next world, but still wonder just how prepared it is.
My soul is secure.
